title: MPs reject early election on December 9
text:
MPs reject December 9 election

MPs have voted against a motion to have an early General election on December 9.

They will now vote on a bill to hold a pre-christmas election on December 12.

The Prime Minister wanted to go to the polls on December 12 – declaring the need for a ‘new and revitalised’ Parliament which is able to deliver Brexit.

The government said a December 9 election would require parliament to be dissolved at the end of Thursday to allow the necessary 25 working days between dissolution and polling.

They say this would make it ‘very difficult’ to get key legislation through the house, such as an election bill and a separate bill on budgets for the suspended Northern Ireland assembly.

However, Labour put forward an amendment to hold one three days earlier.

Ayes 295 Noes 315 – Labour loses attempt to have the election on December 9th, full steam ahead for the 12th December then — Laura Kuenssberg (@bbclaurak) October 29, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

There was concern students may have broken up for Christmas by 12 December and it could be harder to get them to vote if they are travelling between two locations.

Corbyn brought this point up with Johnson on Monday night and was heckled by Conservative MPs.

295 MPs voted for the amendment, while 315 voted against it.

It means the government won by a majority of 20.

This is a breaking news story. More to follow
description: MPs have voted against a motion to have an early General election on December 9. They will now vote on a bill to hold a pre-christmas election on December 12....
